verses.roman:
ramamāṇas tayā devyā
padma-kiñjalka-gandhayā
tan-mukhāmoda-muṣito
mumude 'har-gaṇān bahūn

synonyms: ramamāṇaḥ—enjoying sex; tayā—with her; devyā—the heavenly goddess; padma—of a lotus; kiñjalka—like the saffron; gandhayā—the fragrance of whom; tat-mukha—her beautiful face; āmoda—by the fragrance; muṣitaḥ—being enlivened more and more; mumude—enjoyed life; ahaḥ-gaṇān—days after days; bahūn—many.
translation: Urvaśī's body was as fragrant as the saffron of a lotus. Being enlivened by the fragrance of her face and body, Purūravā enjoyed her company for many days with great jubilation.
